tweet: A minor record or arrest should never create a barrier to a good job, education, or home. Yet for 1 in 3, records keeps the American Dream out of reach. That‚Äôs why I was proud to vote for the #PaycheckFairness Act, which will help close the wage gap, provide protections for workers who come forward to report pay disparity, and provides assistance to all businesses in helping comply with equal pay and salary negotiation programs.
In Delaware women earn better than the national average, but no one should ever earn less than equal pay for equal work. pic.twitter.com/zyX5mc3uSr
Over a 40-year career, the avg woman loses $418K to the #WageGap. But many groups of women lose so much more than that. We need #EqualPay now! #EqualPayDay
Even worse, African American women make only 60 cents on the dollar, and Hispanic women earn 53 cents on the dollar to their white male counterparts. We can do better!
On average, women are paid just 80 cents for every $1 paid to male counterparts.  For women of color, the #wagegap is much larger.  #EqualPay
